articles.author: Carrington Clarke, Joanna Robin
articles.title: The Supreme Court leak has some Americans worried that abortion rights are just the beginning. Here's what could come next - ABC News
articles.description: While the US Supreme Court is scrambling to uncover the source of a bombshell leak, legal scholars who have studied the document say it could have huge implications for America's future, write Carrington Clarke and Joanna Robin.
articles.content:
After half a century, a right many Americans believed was assured could soon be reversed. And others could follow. 
A leaked draft opinion from the Supreme Court, published by Politico, shows justic… [+7523 chars]

articles.title: Q&A - Acute severe hepatitis in children - Pan American Health Organization
articles.description: On 15 April 2022, the World Health Organization (WHO) published an alert on severe acute hepatitis cases of unknown origin in children in the United Kingdom. Since then, there have been continuing additional reports of cases.

articles.title: A total lunar eclipse will turn the moon red the night of May 15 - Space.com
articles.description: It will be visible from the Americas, Europe, Africa, the Middle East, the eastern Pacific, the South Pacific and even Antarctica.
articles.content:
Hot on the heels of the year's first solar eclipse — a partial eclipse on April 30 — a total lunar eclipse is on the horizon.

articles.title: Rare fossil of ancient dog species discovered by paleontologists - Phys.org
articles.description: Sometime around 14,000 years ago, the first humans crossed the Bering Strait to North America with canines, domesticated dogs they used for hunting, by their side.
